titleStmt.title: A letter from Scotland, giving a full and impartiall relation of the scattering of those forces risen against the Parliament; being all taken prisoners by Lieutenant-Generall David Lesly, and now remaining in his hands at Mercy. With an true accompt of all those officers of state removed which had a hand in the late engagement against England: with the names of those placed in their roomes by the Parliament of Scotland.

A letter from Scotland, giving a full and impartiall relation of the scattering of those forces risen against the Parliament; being all taken prisoners by Lieutenant-Generall David Lesly, and now remaining in his hands at Mercy. With an true accompt of all those officers of state removed which had a hand in the late engagement against England: with the names of those placed in their roomes by the Parliament of Scotland.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
